Class Uncontext

  • java.lang.Object
    • uncontext.Uncontext

  • public class Uncontext
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Uncontext

        public Uncontext(PApplet parent,
                 java.lang.String streamName)
        Constructor, this should be used in the setup() method of the sketch. The data stream will connect automatically.

        Typical usage:

        unctx = new Uncontext(this, "literature");

        Parameters:
        parent - The parent applet.
        streamName - A valid uncontext stream name.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        public static void list()
        Print the list of available streams in the debug console.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the stream, if it's running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the stream, if it isn't running.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Check to see if the stream is currently connected.
        Returns:
        True if the stream is connected, False if it isn't.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Clean things up, stop the stream. This is called automatically when the sketch stops.
